chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Amadou Crosley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amadou Crosley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amadou Crosley was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Amadou Crosley was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cts 2 & 3  are Concurrent to Milwaukee Co Case 15-CF-2969.
Credit for 7 days, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
 ** Pay fine of $250.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges on each count.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges (each count).
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.  May not have contact with Gunnard Black, Daita Useni, or Premium Outlet Mall.  Restitution hearing to be scheduled RE: Restitution claim from G.B
Restitution hearing to be scheduled for victim. G.B. before the Commissioner.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED. Consecutive to  Milwaukee Co cases 15-CF-2969 & 16-CF-4224.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.   Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
* Costs converted to a civil judgment.
* Restitution plus surcharges converted to a civil judgment.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  May Not have contact with Gunnar B, Driti U, Premium Outlets.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in custody with Atty James Fields-Bowers.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  136 - Parties have rec'd and reviewed revocation packet. Sentence recommendations. Ct2:   Defendant is sentenced to 8 years in the WSP; 4 years Initial Confinement followed by 4 years of Extended Supervision consecutive to Milwaukee Co. cases 15CF2969, 16CF4224. Ct3:   Defendant is sentenced to 3 years in the WSP; 1.5 years Initial Confinement followed by 1.5 years of Extended Supervision - concurrent to Ct2 but consecutive to Milwaukee Co. cases 15CF2969, 16CF4224.  DE (is ) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 7 days credit. No new costs ordered - any remaining outstanding may be converted to civil judgment.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
SEHR rescheduled to 4/25 @ 1:30pm. Writ to be prepared by DA's office.
Per Judge, Atty Fields-Bowers to receive copy of PSI for sentencing.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:30am-  Victim rights compliance - victim is present.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 4 years w/conditions - concurrent to Milwaukee Co case 15CF2969.  7 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court orders $250.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge on each count.  State requests matter be set for a restitution hearing on the restitution request from victim, G. B., & restitution be ordered as agreed.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $9,295.12.  Restitution hearing to be scheduled before the Court Commissioner as to the restitution claim from victim, G.B.  Appeal rights given.
For restitution - signed by ADA J Zapf.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  1:57pm-  Victim rights compliance - victim is present.  Discussion held re: issue with restitution amount.  Court adjourns sentencing hearing to allow Attorney Henry time to discuss the issue w/ the DE & determine how the DE would like to proceed.  Sentencing hearing adjourned to September 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.
8/17/2015 Sentencing hearing is moved from 10am to 1:30pm.  Parties notified via email.
Attorney Henry is requesting 7/24/2015 Sentencing hearing be rescheduled as she is in trial in another court.  Sentencing hearing is rescheduled to 8/17/2015 at 10am.  Parties notified via email.
For restitution order - filed by ADA J Zapf.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  1:51pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Henry is requesting matter be removed from the trial calendar & matter be set for a plea hearing - DE has a trial set in Milwaukee Co for 6/29/2015 & would like to know the outcome of that case prior to entering a plea.  Court denies request.  Parties to be prepared for trial on 6/22/2015.  Discussion held.  2:09pm-  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 2; found guilty by the court.  Defendant entered a plea of no contest to count 3; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 1 & 4 are dismissed. Presentence Investigation ordered.  6/22/2015 JT removed from the court's calendar.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  No appearance by the Defendant or Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  Attorney Chavez appeared but had to leave.  DE not brought over.  Court adjourns matter to June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:33am-  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is not resolved.  DE is requesting matter be set for trial.  Court sets matter for trial.  Court orders all witness lists & motions in limine be filed by 5/9/2015.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:42am-  DE was not brought over for today's hearing.  Victim rights compliance.  DE is in custody in Milwaukee Co on new charges & that case is set for trial on 3/9/2015.  Attorney Henry is requesting an adjournment until after the trial in the Milwaukee Co case.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to March 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
